segment.source: Set your MDM Management Authority
segment.target: Set your MDM Management Authority

segment.source: Set your MDM Management Authority
segment.target: Set your MDM Management Authority

segment.source: Before you can enroll mobile devices, you must declare or as your mobile device management authority.
segment.target: Before you can enroll mobile devices, you must declare or as your mobile device management authority.

segment.source: A mobile device management authority defines the single management service with permission to manage a set of devices.
segment.target: A mobile device management authority defines the single management service with permission to manage a set of devices.

segment.source: Solutions for the mobile device management authority include , Configuration Manager with , or Office 365 MDM solutions.
segment.target: Solutions for the mobile device management authority include , Configuration Manager with , or Office 365 MDM solutions.

segment.source: Consider carefully whether you want to manage mobile devices using Intune only, System Center Configuration Manager with Intune integration, or using Office 365.
segment.target: Consider carefully whether you want to manage mobile devices using Intune only, System Center Configuration Manager with Intune integration, or using Office 365.

segment.source: After you set the mobile device management authority to either of these options, it cannot be changed again.
segment.target: After you set the mobile device management authority to either of these options, it cannot be changed again.

segment.source: If you're unsure of your options, see Ways to do enterprise mobility.
segment.target: If you're unsure of your options, see Ways to do enterprise mobility.

segment.source: Make Intune your MDM authority
segment.target: Make Intune your MDM authority

segment.source: Set mobile device management authority
segment.target: Set mobile device management authority

segment.source: Set mobile device management authority as Intune
segment.target: Set mobile device management authority as Intune

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console click Admin > Mobile Device Management.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console click Admin > Mobile Device Management.

segment.source: In the Tasks list, click Set Mobile Device Management Authority.
segment.target: In the Tasks list, click Set Mobile Device Management Authority.

segment.source: The Set MDM Authority dialog box opens.
segment.target: The Set MDM Authority dialog box opens.

segment.source: Intune requests confirmation that you want Intune as your MDM authority.
segment.target: Intune requests confirmation that you want Intune as your MDM authority.

segment.source: Check the box and then click Yes to use Microsoft Intune to manage mobile devices.
segment.target: Check the box and then click Yes to use Microsoft Intune to manage mobile devices.

segment.source: Make Configuration Manager your MDM authority
segment.target: Make Configuration Manager your MDM authority

segment.source: To set as your mobile device management authority and begin managing devices with , you must complete the following steps:
segment.target: To set as your mobile device management authority and begin managing devices with , you must complete the following steps:

segment.source: Subscribe to
segment.target: Subscribe to

segment.source: Set as your MDM authority
segment.target: Set as your MDM authority

segment.source: Configure the Microsoft Intune Connector role
segment.target: Configure the Microsoft Intune Connector role

segment.source: Configuring the Microsoft Intune Subscription
segment.target: Configuring the Microsoft Intune Subscription

segment.source: The subscription lets you specify your configuration settings for the service.
segment.target: The subscription lets you specify your configuration settings for the service.

segment.source: This includes specifying which users can enroll their devices and defining which mobile device platforms to manage.
segment.target: This includes specifying which users can enroll their devices and defining which mobile device platforms to manage.

segment.source: When you have created your subscription, you can then install the Microsoft Intune connector site system role that lets you connect to the service.
segment.target: When you have created your subscription, you can then install the Microsoft Intune connector site system role that lets you connect to the service.

segment.source: This connector site system role will push settings and applications to the service.
segment.target: This connector site system role will push settings and applications to the service.

segment.source: The subscription performs the following:
segment.target: The subscription performs the following:

segment.source: Retrieves the certificate that the Microsoft Intune connector requires to connect to the service.
segment.target: Retrieves the certificate that the Microsoft Intune connector requires to connect to the service.

segment.source: Defines the user collection that enables users to enroll mobile devices.
segment.target: Defines the user collection that enables users to enroll mobile devices.

segment.source: Defines and configures the mobile platforms that you want to support.
segment.target: Defines and configures the mobile platforms that you want to support.

segment.source: To create the Microsoft Intune subscription
segment.target: To create the Microsoft Intune subscription

segment.source: In the console, click Administration.
segment.target: In the console, click Administration.

segment.source: Choose the steps that are appropriate for your version of :
segment.target: Choose the steps that are appropriate for your version of :

segment.source: For SP1:
segment.target: For SP1:

segment.source: In the Administration workspace, expand Hierarchy Configuration, and click Microsoft Intune Subscriptions.
segment.target: In the Administration workspace, expand Hierarchy Configuration, and click Microsoft Intune Subscriptions.

segment.source: On the Home tab, click Create Microsoft Intune Subscription.
segment.target: On the Home tab, click Create Microsoft Intune Subscription.

segment.source: For SP2 and
segment.target: For SP2 and

segment.source: System Center R2 Configuration Manager 2012 SP1:
segment.target: System Center R2 Configuration Manager 2012 SP1:

segment.source: In the Administration workspace, expand Cloud Services, and click Microsoft Intune Subscriptions.
segment.target: In the Administration workspace, expand Cloud Services, and click Microsoft Intune Subscriptions.

segment.source: On the Home tab, click Add Microsoft Intune Subscription.
segment.target: On the Home tab, click Add Microsoft Intune Subscription.

segment.source: On the Introduction page of the Create Microsoft Intune Subscription Wizard, review the text and click Next.
segment.target: On the Introduction page of the Create Microsoft Intune Subscription Wizard, review the text and click Next.

segment.source: On the Subscription page, click Sign in and sign in by using your work or school account.
segment.target: On the Subscription page, click Sign in and sign in by using your work or school account.

segment.source: In the Set the Mobile Device Management Authority dialog, select the check box to only manage mobile devices by using through the console.
segment.target: In the Set the Mobile Device Management Authority dialog, select the check box to only manage mobile devices by using through the console.

segment.source: To continue with your subscription, you must select this option.
segment.target: To continue with your subscription, you must select this option.

segment.source: Once you select as your management authority, you cannot change the management authority to in the future.
segment.target: Once you select as your management authority, you cannot change the management authority to in the future.

segment.source: Click the privacy links to review them, and then click Next.
segment.target: Click the privacy links to review them, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the General page, specify the following options, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the General page, specify the following options, and then click Next.

segment.source: Collection: Specify a user collection that contains users who will enroll their mobile devices.
segment.target: Collection: Specify a user collection that contains users who will enroll their mobile devices.

segment.source: If a user is removed from the collection, the user’s device will continue to be managed for up to 24 hours when the user record is removed from the user database.
segment.target: If a user is removed from the collection, the user’s device will continue to be managed for up to 24 hours when the user record is removed from the user database.

segment.source: Company name: Specify your company name.
segment.target: Company name: Specify your company name.

segment.source: URL to company privacy documentation: If you publish your company privacy information to a link that is accessible from the Internet, provide a link that users can access from the company portal, for example http://www.contoso.com/CP_privacy.html.
segment.target: URL to company privacy documentation: If you publish your company privacy information to a link that is accessible from the Internet, provide a link that users can access from the company portal, for example http://www.contoso.com/CP_privacy.html.

segment.source: Privacy information can clarify what information users are sharing with your company.
segment.target: Privacy information can clarify what information users are sharing with your company.

segment.source: Color scheme for company portal: Optionally, change the default color of blue for the company portals.
segment.target: Color scheme for company portal: Optionally, change the default color of blue for the company portals.

segment.source: Configuration Manager site code: Specify a site code for a primary site to manage the mobile devices.
segment.target: Configuration Manager site code: Specify a site code for a primary site to manage the mobile devices.

segment.source: Changing the site code affects only new enrollments and does not affect existing enrolled devices.
segment.target: Changing the site code affects only new enrollments and does not affect existing enrolled devices.

segment.source: On the Company Contact Information page, specify the company contact information that is displayed in the company portal, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Company Contact Information page, specify the company contact information that is displayed in the company portal, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Company Logo page, choose whether to display a logo in the company portal, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Company Logo page, choose whether to display a logo in the company portal, and then click Next.

segment.source: Prior to SP2, on the Platforms page, select the device types that you want to manage and review the platform requirements, and then click Next.
segment.target: Prior to SP2, on the Platforms page, select the device types that you want to manage and review the platform requirements, and then click Next.

segment.source: For each device type that you select, you must configure additional options.
segment.target: For each device type that you select, you must configure additional options.

segment.source: Use the procedures that follow for more information about those options.
segment.target: Use the procedures that follow for more information about those options.

segment.source: After you have configured these additional options, click Next.
segment.target: After you have configured these additional options, click Next.

segment.source: Complete the wizard.
segment.target: Complete the wizard.

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune Connector Site System Role
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune Connector Site System Role

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune connector sends settings and software deployment information to and retrieves status and inventory messages from mobile devices.
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune connector sends settings and software deployment information to and retrieves status and inventory messages from mobile devices.

segment.source: The service acts as a gateway that communicates with mobile devices and stores settings.
segment.target: The service acts as a gateway that communicates with mobile devices and stores settings.

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune connector site system role may only be installed on a central administration site or stand-alone primary site.
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune connector site system role may only be installed on a central administration site or stand-alone primary site.

segment.source: To configure the Microsoft Intune Connector role
segment.target: To configure the Microsoft Intune Connector role

segment.source: In the console, click Administration.
segment.target: In the console, click Administration.

segment.source: In the Administration workspace, expand Site Configuration, and then click Servers and Site System Roles.
segment.target: In the Administration workspace, expand Site Configuration, and then click Servers and Site System Roles.

segment.source: Add the connector role to a new or existing site system server by using the associated step:
segment.target: Add the connector role to a new or existing site system server by using the associated step:

segment.source: New site system server: On the Home tab, in the Create group, click Create Site System Server to start the Create Site System Server Wizard.
segment.target: New site system server: On the Home tab, in the Create group, click Create Site System Server to start the Create Site System Server Wizard.

segment.source: Existing site system server: Click the server on which you want to install the Microsoft Intune connector role.
segment.target: Existing site system server: Click the server on which you want to install the Microsoft Intune connector role.

segment.source: Then, on the Home tab, in the Server group, click Add Site System Roles to start the Add Site system Roles Wizard.
segment.target: Then, on the Home tab, in the Server group, click Add Site System Roles to start the Add Site system Roles Wizard.

segment.source: On the System Role Selection page, select Microsoft Intune Connector, and click Next.
segment.target: On the System Role Selection page, select Microsoft Intune Connector, and click Next.

segment.source: Complete the wizard.
segment.target: Complete the wizard.

segment.source: How does the Microsoft Intune Connector Authenticate with the Microsoft Intune Service?
segment.target: How does the Microsoft Intune Connector Authenticate with the Microsoft Intune Service?

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune Connector extends by establishing a connection to the cloud-based service that manages mobile devices over the Internet.
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune Connector extends by establishing a connection to the cloud-based service that manages mobile devices over the Internet.

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune Connection authenticates with the service as follows:
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune Connection authenticates with the service as follows:

segment.source: When you create a subscription in the console, the admin is authenticated by connecting to Azure Active Directory, which redirects to the respective ADFS server to prompt for user name and password.
segment.target: When you create a subscription in the console, the admin is authenticated by connecting to Azure Active Directory, which redirects to the respective ADFS server to prompt for user name and password.

segment.source: Then, issues a certificate to the tenant.
segment.target: Then, issues a certificate to the tenant.

segment.source: The certificate from step 1 is installed on the Microsoft Intune Connector site role and is used to authenticate and authorize all further communication with the Microsoft Intune service.
segment.target: The certificate from step 1 is installed on the Microsoft Intune Connector site role and is used to authenticate and authorize all further communication with the Microsoft Intune service.
